chinese: necessary 必要的；需要的
examples: e.g. He could only think of how [[needful]] it was to take the train and get quietly away.

chinese: [pl.] limits or borders 界限；范围
examples: e.g. We can't really discuss feminism within the [[confines]] of such a short novel.

chinese: prevent the development of sb. / sth. 限制，束缚（某人或某事物的发展）
examples: e.g. Some people are worried that stricter anti-pollution laws may [[cramp]] economic growth.

chinese: (fml.) harmful or poisonous 有害的；有毒的
examples: e.g. Environmentalists warned that heavy industry pollutes our rivers with [[noxious]] chemicals.

chinese: used for treating medical problems 有疗效的；有药效的
examples: e.g. Her interest was rekindled when she saw herbs in everyday [[medicinal]] use there.

chinese: make sth. return to its former state or condition 使恢复；使回复
examples: e.g. The government promises to [[restore]] the economy to its full strength by the end of the year.

chinese: [C] (AmE) a lawyer 律师
examples: e.g. He decided to consult with an [[attorney]] about this particular case.

chinese: [sing] a loud unpleasant noise that continues for a long time （持久的）嘈杂声，喧闹声
examples: e.g. They waved their arms and shouted, trying to make themselves heard over the [[din]] of the crowd.

chinese: 1) [U] ( fml.) skill in making people believe what you want them to believe 诡计；手腕
examples: e.g. He knew how to win by [[craft]] and diplomacy what he could not gain by force.；e.g. It's lucky that all kinds of traditional [[craft]] industries are preserved here.

chinese: 2) [C] a traditional skill of making things by hand （传统）手（工）艺
examples: e.g. He knew how to win by [[craft]] and diplomacy what he could not gain by force.；e.g. It's lucky that all kinds of traditional [[craft]] industries are preserved here.

chinese: (the ~) the line far away where the land or sea seems to meet the sky 地平线
examples: e.g. He backed away from the edge, looking all around at the flat [[horizon]].

chinese: (fml.) relating to the body, rather than to the mind, feelings, or spirit 身体的；肉体的
examples: e.g. And then there is our own body, our own [[corporeal]] instrument, which we're awfully proud of.

chinese: [C, U] an unusual, exciting, or impressive event or sight 壮观的景象；奇观
examples: e.g. Watching a lion chasing its prey is one of nature's most exciting [[spectacles]].

chinese: move slowly on water or in the air 漂流；飘动
examples: e.g. I looked up at the clouds [[floating]] in the sky.

chinese: dark purple-red in color 深红色的；绯红色的
examples: e.g. They walked past fields with huge sprays of [[crimson]], yellow and purple flowers.

chinese: (partook, partaken) (fml.) take part in an activity or event 参加；参与
examples: e.g. Retailers who [[partake]] in the campaign should place a sticker on their window.

chinese: a complete change into sb. / sth. very different, or the process during which this happens 彻底改观；变化过程
examples: e.g. After three weeks, we noticed a total [[transformation]] in his behavior and attitude.

chinese: [U] the quality of being very pleasant or attractive 迷人；魅力
examples: e.g. As the mountain path spirals up, the beauty of the scene fills each of us with [[enchantment]].

chinese: become bigger and wider, or make sth. do this （使）膨胀；（使）扩大
examples: e.g. Red wine can help to [[dilate]] blood vessels.

chinese: secretly plan with sb. to do sth. bad or illegal 搞阴谋；密谋
examples: e.g. The company is accused of [[conspiring]] with three other local stores to fix prices.

chinese: treat sb. / sth. with extreme respect and admiration 崇拜；把···神化；把···奉若神明
examples: e.g. We are inclined to [[deify]] successful people, and in our time that certainly includes CEOs.

chinese: [U] formal ceremony, esp. involving expensive clothes, special traditions, etc. 华典；盛典；盛况
examples: e.g. She arrived at the airport without the [[pomp]] that usually accompanies important politicians.

chinese: [C] (also faery) a fairy 仙子；小精灵
(also mystical) involving religious, spiritual, or magical powers that people cannot understand 神奇的；神秘的
examples: e.g. He has undergone a profound [[mystic]] experience over the past two months.

chinese: [U] the tendency to be easily affected or influenced by sth. 易受影响（或感染）的倾向；敏感性
examples: e.g. One of the side effects of the drug is an increased [[susceptibility]] to infection.

chinese: [C] a small thin piece that breaks away easily from sth. else 小薄片
examples: e.g. Toward the middle of the night, large [[flakes]] of snow began to fall swiftly.

chinese: (fml.) change sth., esp. in order to achieve a particular effect 改变；调整
examples: e.g. Teachers [[modulate]] the way they work in response to their students' needs.

chinese: [C] a small amount of a particular color 浅色；淡色调
examples: e.g. Green has many different shades and [[tints]].

chinese: [U] a calm or relaxed state 安详；休息
examples: e.g. The atmosphere in the hall is one of [[repose]] rather than excitement.

chinese: [C] 磨坊
[C] （教堂或其他建筑物的）尖顶
(also calyx) (pl. calices) 花萼
[U] （庄稼收割后遗留的）残株，茬
cover sth. with frost 使···蒙上白霜
examples: e.g. He does not brush away the frost that [[rimes]] his beard.

chinese: not speaking, or not willing to speak 缄默的；无声的
examples: e.g. Marianna, the king's daughter, became [[mute]] after a shock.

chinese: friendly and kind 友好的；善良的
examples: e.g. He was a warm-hearted friend and [[genial]] host, liked by everyone he met.

chinese: (beheld, beheld) see sth. 看；看见
examples: e.g. He looked up and [[beheld]] a stranger sitting across the table, smiling a secret smile.

chinese: 1) great beauty 壮丽；灿烂
examples: e.g. It will cost millions of pounds to [[restore]] the castle into its former [[glory]].；e.g. Walsham had his moment of [[glory]] when he won a 20 km race last week in London.

chinese: 2) admiration and praise that you get because you have done sth. impressive 荣誉；光荣
examples: e.g. It will cost millions of pounds to [[restore]] the castle into its former [[glory]].；e.g. Walsham had his moment of [[glory]] when he won a 20 km race last week in London.

chinese: [U] darkness in which it is difficult to see clearly 昏暗
examples: e.g. She peered into the [[gloom]], but she couldn't see where the noise was coming from.

chinese: make sb. / sth. different 使变样；改变
examples: e.g. This doesn't [[alter]] the fact that what you did was wrong. You'd better call him and apologize.

chinese: [sing.] a series of people or things of the same type 一连串，一系列（同类型的人或物）
examples: e.g. I can't understand why after graduation he took a [[succession]] of low-paid jobs.

chinese: [C, U] 牧场
1) a group of related animals or plants （动植物的）族，群
examples: e.g. They didn't quite expect that this [[tribe]] of cats could give them so much trouble.；e.g. The elders in the [[tribe]] want to protect their traditional way of life.

chinese: 2) a social group consisting of people of the same race who have the same beliefs, language, etc. and usually live in one particular area ruled by their leader 部落
examples: e.g. They didn't quite expect that this [[tribe]] of cats could give them so much trouble.；e.g. The elders in the [[tribe]] want to protect their traditional way of life.

chinese: arriving or happening at the time agreed on 按时的；准时的
examples: e.g. She's always very [[punctual]] for appointments and because of this she is highly respected.

chinese: [C] 河道；溪流
[C, U] 梭鱼草
[C, U] 小狗鱼草
(of trees or plants) produce flower 开花
examples: e.g. Most roses will begin to [[bloom]] from late May and the garden will be at its best.

chinese: (of people, animals, etc.) move around in a large group （人、动物等）成群地来回移动
examples: e.g. Every day tourists [[swarm]] through the narrow streets of the old city.

chinese: continuing all the time 长期的；永恒的
examples: e.g. I thought her [[perpetual]] complaints were going to prove too much for me.

chinese: [C] a special performance or event to celebrate sth. 特别演出；欢庆活动；庆典
examples: e.g. We ate dinner and watched the Spring Festival [[Gala]] together on New Year's Eve.

chinese: [C] a small attractive object used for decoration or for making sb. / sth. more beautiful 装饰品；点缀品
examples: e.g. I guessed he was the chief because he wore more gold [[ornaments]] than the others.

chinese: wet with drops of dew 带露水的
examples: e.g. The grass was [[dewy]], the apples green, but already fragrant.

chinese: [C] 果园
[C, U] a flower on a tree, or all the flowers on a tree （一棵树上的）花，全部花朵
examples: e.g. Rain begins to fall and peach trees are in [[blossom]].

chinese: (fml.) laugh at sb. / sth. in an unkind way, esp. by copying what they say or do 嘲弄；（通过模仿）取笑
examples: e.g. The other children [[mocked]] the girl's French accent, laughing behind their hands.

chinese: used to emphasize how small or unimportant sb. / sth. is 仅仅的，只不过（用于强调小或微不足道）
examples: e.g. We don't consider our customers to be [[mere]] consumers; we consider them to be our friends.

chinese: [U] （装饰用的）闪光纸
shine with a soft light that looks as if it shakes slightly 发微光；闪闪发亮
examples: e.g. My thoughts [[shimmer]] with the shimmering leaves and my heart sings with the touch of this sunlight.

chinese: hold sth. tightly because one does not want to lose it 紧握；紧抓
examples: e.g. The young man stood in the doorway, his invitation [[clutched]] tightly in his hand.

chinese: [C] an effect caused by hot air in deserts, at sea, or on roads, which makes you think that you can see objects when they are not actually there 幻景；海市蜃楼
examples: e.g. She thought at first it must be the edge of an oasis, then realized it was a [[mirage]].

chinese: (fml.) the attitude or behavior of sb. who works very hard and very carefully 勤奋；用功
examples: e.g. We should cultivate the good habits of [[diligence]] and frugality (节俭).

chinese: [C] a sign that sth. is soon going to happen 预兆
examples: e.g. If this first opera of the season is a [[herald]] of what is to come, we can expect great things.

chinese: 1) felt or experienced in your own mind but not expressed to other people 内心的；精神的
examples: e.g. She watched his expression, saw the relaxation of his features, and breathed an [[inward]] sigh of relief.；e.g. The car was not severely damaged — only the middle of the car door was bent [[inward]].

chinese: 2) toward the inside or center of sth. 向内的；向中心的
examples: e.g. She watched his expression, saw the relaxation of his features, and breathed an [[inward]] sigh of relief.；e.g. The car was not severely damaged — only the middle of the car door was bent [[inward]].

chinese: (also as long as) used before saying the conditions that will make sth. else happen or be true 只要
examples: e.g. So long as you try your best, it doesn't matter whether you win or not.

chinese: used for including other similar people or things in what you are saying 诸如此类；等等
examples: e.g. Many words are compounds, such as blackboard, inkpot, bookstore, and the like.

chinese: 亚述（古代东方奴隶制国家）
帕福斯（塞浦路斯西南部古城）
荷马（古希腊诗人）
